intro: Saurauia ilicifolia, commonly known as the Indian holly, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy, elliptical, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small, white, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Saurauia ilicifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
